title: Little Rock Central High School National Historic Site: Accessibility
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Accessibility             Accessibility       Physical/ Mobility Access Visitor Center  Accessible parking is available. See map to the visitor center. The visitor center is equipped with automated doors and accessible entrances and restrooms. A Wheelchair is available on request for use at the site. Touchscreens and video displays in the exhibit area are captioned. Exhibit cases and panels follow Smithsonian Guidelines for Accessible Exhibition Design.          Guided Tours  Tours using an accessible entrance to Little Rock Central High School are available. Prior reservation is recommended. Please let the Ranger know that your party would like to use an accessible entrance. Visit the Guided Tours page for more information. An elevator (the "Tigervator") is available in the school to move between floors while on tour. Please let the Ranger know if you would like to use it. Letting the park know in advance that your party would like an accessible route through the school is greatly appreciated and, at times, may be necessary. Depending on what is happening at the school, security may need prior notice to enable tours to pass through certain doors.         Deaf/ Hearing Loss  The park media room is equipped with telecoil (T-coil) transmitter equipment. Video and computer displays throughout the exhibit area are captioned.         Blind/ Low Vision  Units providing an audio described tour of the exhibit area are available at the visitor center's front desk.
